website_summaries.verdict: More scientific approach to dog dental care, leveraging enzymatic action plus mechanical abrasion to freshen breath and remove plaque and tartar.
pros: Fights plaque and tartar through combination of natural antiseptic formulation plus mechanical abrasion
Offers in-mouth bacterial control through exclusive dual-enzyme system
Made with high-quality beef hide for great taste
Virbac also produces other specialized chews for dog dental care
cons: The chews vary in size and thickness, making it more difficult to regulate daily use with dogs

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown. Product ingredients have changed
customer_reviews.text: This product has changed ingredients. It is not shipped in this packaging and after giving it to a fussy dog who used to love the product ... and now will not eat them we decided to read the ingredients. Matching them against the old package which is pictured we found the reason... a change in recipe. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but felt I should on this product. I received these Wednesday of this week and gave one right away to my 6 year old dachshund mix. He woke me up at 1 am the next morning, wanting to go out. He had diarrhea, and had it all day Thursday. He ate nothing that day other than his usual food. It's now Friday and he still has it. I wouldn't order these again, don't recommend them, and would advise against giving them to a dog that doesn't have an iron stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: I pulled out a four inch long string out of his mouth that was as tough as dental floss and even looked like dental floss that w
customer_reviews.text: We've been buying these for our 8 lb. minpin for years and he really likes them....EXCEPT the other day we found him choking while eating a stick. I pulled out a four inch long string out of his mouth that was as tough as dental floss and even looked like dental floss that was imbedded in the chew. I'm worried that this might happen again...lucky I was around when it did. Has anyone else experienced this? Please see picture.
customer_reviews.author: Hueneme_Beachboy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dogs teeth!
customer_reviews.text: These are basically a miracle product. My dog has always had bad breath and poor dental health. At our most recent visit it was suggested that our vet put our dog under anesthesia and do deep cleaning. It was not a promised cure since it might need to be done yearly. The kicker was that the procedure would cost well over $1500. I decided to try out this product because of the reviews and recommendation from our vet. THEY WORK! After almost a month of a single chew daily we are seeing a huge improvement in our dogs dental health. We are going to just include a single chew daily to prevent any further issues. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: NOT A  SUBSTITUTE FOR BRUSHING!
customer_reviews.text: My dog kd ❤️s these dental chews. And they may help w/ a dog’s oral health care. BUT they’re not a substitute for brushing a dog’s teeth if one can’t trust their dog w/ chew sticks (nothing personal [OH, NO!], kd!). I trusted using these w/out brushing her teeth. But after kd had four teeth extracted at 2 yrs of age when her teeth were cleaned, I started brushing her teeth twice a day. At age 6, kd has beautiful teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Gregorio

customer_reviews.title: They not only clean theirs teeth but also prevent bad breath. And my dogs love to chew on ...
customer_reviews.text: I use enzymatic oral higiene chews for several years now and they work very well on chihuahuas very well. They not only clean theirs teeth but also prevent bad breath. And my dogs love to chew on them. Very good product, I recommend it. Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gives an upset stomach
customer_reviews.text: I remember this happening a few times in the past, but now I’m sure of it....every time I give them to my 8 lb chi, ( only half at a time), she doesn’t feel well the next day and refuses to eat all day. It’s happened 3 times already with this new bag. ...even waited days between servings. Maybe it’s the raw hide consistency? Not sure what the problem is, but I will not be buying these again. Very disappointed because of the good reviews and the fact that she won’t let me brush her teeth nor get dentals anymore because of heart issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burger

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog flips out over these, she loves them! She's a 4 year old maltipoo and her back teeth were looking orange/brown and brushing them wasn't doing much. To avoid a teeth cleaning at the vet, I searched Amazon and found these treats. I also purchased Plaque Off seaweed powder. Her teeth have been sparkling white after a few weeks of using both every day - and we have also noticed that she doesn't have bad breath anymore!! Since we've used both products consistently I'm really not sure if one product works better than the other, but I do know that she loves these treats and they have definitely helped keep her teeth clean so I will keep buying them!!
customer_reviews.author: Pearl Marie

customer_reviews.title: Nearly killed my dog
customer_reviews.text: Warning: I almost lost my beautiful Mathew to a stomach obstruction caused by Virbac CET dental chews. Within an hour of eating half of a stick, his belly bloated, his breathing became labored. He was crying. After hours of emergency vet care, attempting to dislodge the pieces, deep in his belly, he faced surgery or cardiac arrest. I saw and have pictures of the remains of the chew. It was like shards, not dissolving, hard and compacted. Please don't feed these. More than $5k later, I am devastated that I let him eat these, that it could have been avoided. He's been in the hospital for 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on getting built on tarter and plaque off teeth. Very palatable, I didn’t think my dog would like these because she is not big on chews, but she loves these with a passion. She also loves the CET toothpaste too, so not very surprised. I wish these weren’t rawhide though, as I do worry about blockages in her intestines. So I give her a half to maybe one whole one once, rarely twice a week to be sure these aren’t causing any issues. Directions say once a day is fine, but I’m just going to keep being overly cautious.
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Chris

customer_reviews.title: It be great if they were a softer
customer_reviews.text: they were hard for my little girl to chew so I soak them in hot water and then gave them to her and she was able to eat them then She really likes them and that is also the brand name of the toothpaste that I have used for her for the last two years good check up at the vet will see you this year How she does
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: Recall notice was recently released
customer_reviews.text: So ..... I had noticed my dogs had very recently developed diarrhea . Stopped using these immediately and dogs seem okay . Threw them away .... real shame because dogs do like them .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog plaque!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this worked to clean all the gross brown and black spots off my dog's teeth! I thought for sure she would need some pulled, but giving her these treats regularly cleaned them all up within a 2 weeks! She goes crazy for them too and theyre easy on her tummy even though shes a senior and has some digestion issues. I will definitely be buying more! Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Martyna

customer_reviews.title: Best Bones For Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My Vet turned me on to these chews several years ago and I have purchased them ever since. They don't seem to ever make my dog sick like some rawhide or actual bones do and they tend to keep her teeth clean, although I brush her teeth every night. She gets a bone at bedtime and is great until morning when she wants her food.... I feel these are safe for any dog and do no harm to their mouth or stomach.
customer_reviews.author: K. F.

customer_reviews.title: 3.4 # Pup has only (3) teeth but LOVES These.....
customer_reviews.text: My 3.4 # Teacup poodle was a rescue pup from last August 2015. He came to us and we immediately had to have his teeth cleaned which resulted in 14 being pulled. That left him with (3) teeth. One on left in the back and two on the right. Believe it or not, he LOVES these bones. We break them in half for him and soak them in water for a few minutes to "soften" them up for the initial chew. We hope they are keeping the (3) remaining teeth clean because we will not put him thru the stress of cleaning for (3) teeth. I highly recommend these treats..............
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Julie M. Clement

customer_reviews.title: Not helping With plaque management
customer_reviews.text: I have two mini doxies ages 3 and 6. Both dogs enjoy these sticks although they don’t make a difference in either of my dogs oral health. My dogs have have always had regular cleanings and checkups, the plaque and dog breath is the same as without using these sticks. The health claims stated on the bag were not observed in our case with two years of regular use.
customer_reviews.author: kelleyn

customer_reviews.title: These are fake!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been ordering these for years from my vet and from a different seller on amazon and my dog has been fine. I decided to try this seller as they were cheaper but when I received them they looked very different in color and thickness from the originals. The bag design was also different. I decided to give it to my dog and it gave her bad diarrhea every time she ate it. I returned them and went back to the other seller on Amazon. Beware these are fake!!!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Mandujano

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not give these to your small dog. I have been giving these to my dog for a few months and he recently had to have emergency surgery to remove two chunks of these from his stomach that did not dissolve as they are meant to. This involved a major surgery, several nights stay at a hospital, and over $2,000 in medical bills. Definitely will NOT ever buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did something change with these chews?
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving these chews to my dog daily for the past year, without fail. Initially, they seem to do a great job controlling my dogs breath odor and improving the appearance of my dog's teeth. However, the last bag does not seem to be doing the job. The bad breath is back and plaque is again building up on her teeth. I don't know if there was a change in the product or if there was some kind of problem with the batch.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy's Tropical Garden

customer_reviews.title: Dog who is a garbage disposal won't touch these!
customer_reviews.text: My dog who will eat pretty much anything won't touch these! We have tried multiple times and doesn't give them a second sniff! To me this indicates there is something wrong with these because our dog is practically a garbage disposal!
customer_reviews.author: csich2

customer_reviews.title: MY YORKIE LOVES THESE
customer_reviews.text: I did not give these a sniff, therefore, I did not rate the scent. My dog obviously loves the flavor, this is a reordered item and I also got a bag for my daughter's chihuahua. They are safe and although my dog is only 4 lbs., he never chokes on these. If he gets restless on the plane, I just break one in half and he enjoys it for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: ladyrs

customer_reviews.title: Easier than brushing!
customer_reviews.text: My dog Ruby hates me to brush her teeth, but she loves these chews! Last year, my vet said Ruby's tartar was so built up, she would likely need a dental cleaning this year. I started giving Ruby one of these CET chews every morning and a Veggie-dent chew after supper. This year, Ruby's teeth have improved so much, the vet said we could put it off another year. I'm hoping her teeth continue to stay healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Rubyskeeper

customer_reviews.title: Great for teeth
customer_reviews.text: My sheltie loves these. Great for teeth! Our vet likes how clean our dogs teeth are. I have bought several times... thinking about monthly ordering option.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Big Breath Improvement, or Not
customer_reviews.text: Our Havanese loves these, but makes quick works of them, so I've learned to divide them in two and space the halves out by 10-15 minutes. Immediate breath improvement seems to last through a couple of meals. Unfortunately, our Yorkie snubs them, but she's 13 and her teeth are not in good shape, so she has a hard time chewing them. Tried soaking and micro-waving (solutions suggested on line), but former makes them soggy, latter seems only to make them hot. Oh well, half is better than none.
customer_reviews.author: 1yzyngy

customer_reviews.title: My dog enjoys them.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to notice a difference in my dog's teeth, although she does enjoy crunching them up. She gets one per day and we are on our third month in a row of them. The reviews and marketing I read before buying them, made them sound like a miracle product that would surely whiten my dog's teeth. I would say they are not a miracle product. I even use them in conjunction with a plaque removing water additive and still can't say i notice a difference in her teeth being any cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: JeremiahD

customer_reviews.title: Vet recommended
customer_reviews.text: Our chihuahua is 11 years old and stomach has become more and more sensitive to typical treats. Our vet gave us a sample pack of these to try and he did well with them, plus he loves them. He gets one per day. We bought a second pack to make sure he and all was still well, so now we stock up on these as need. Plus they are good for his teeth. Our chihuahua is 10 pounds and a whole one of these is just the right size. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chace 1693

customer_reviews.title: ... daily for a couple of years now and I'm pleased with how it helps with their oral care
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding this to my two yorkies daily for a couple of years now and I'm pleased with how it helps with their oral care. As many yorkie owner would already know, they are prone to oral issue likes tooth decay and teeth loss. My dogs hate to get their teeth brush, so I resorted to using this as it was also recommended by their vet. Not only are these chews helping with oral care, they also serves as a treat to my two fur babies as they enjoy them as treats.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Effective.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure my dogs were going to like these, as they didn’t appear nor smell flavorful - they didn’t look or smell like much of anything, actually. However, my dogs loved them, though. They appear to have been effective. After about a week without any, I could tell the difference in their breath from not having them.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymiss.Anomaly

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: My little Shorkie (7 pounds) always had dental problems but otherwise in great health. I had her teeth cleaned at the vet several times, which is costly. She now gets one of these chews every night , and I see a marked improvement in the cleanliness and color of her teeth and gums. Too bad I didn't try these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: LBBLegal

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product! Its advertised as a chew my dogs are 5 and 6 pounds they had these gone in seconds flat. One of the dogs had a hard time pooping and didn't go for a few days after which is not normal for this pup. These are priced way too high for a quick snack. I have purchased this brand (the larger sized) chews and they have been good for weeks with lots of chewing fun. These are no good.
customer_reviews.author: gamegirl

customer_reviews.title: Always buy
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my dog who has notoriously bad teeth. This helps a lot in between brushes and she enjoys eating them. These were recommended from her vet and has sincerely cut down on her teeth issues. I recommend these to family and friends when dealing with their own pet's oral health issues! Price on Amazon is much better than in-stores as well, so win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Angela R.

customer_reviews.title: Work as well as any other dental chew, but can't compare to........
customer_reviews.text: These work as well as any other dental chew product I have tried, which is at least 15. Nothing beats the real toothbrush and toothpaste, but that is time consuming and if you are in a rush.....you have a problem, especially with two dogs. These Virbic dental chews work but they are small so in order to get visible results, you have to let your dog have 1 1/2 chews which is too bad for a few reasons, one of them is if you have several dogs and you are not a millionaire.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleHeartLane

customer_reviews.title: My Dog LOVES!
customer_reviews.text: My sweet baby girl is such a picky eater. She doesn't like a lot of food and treats but will literally snatch these out of my had before I can even get it out of the bag. I was a little nervous and skeptical at first. Only giving 5 stars because I think they're just a bit pricey. But good quality none-the-less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are RAWHIDE.
customer_reviews.text: These are pure RAWHIDE. Nowhere on the French-written language packaging does it state this fact. Secondly, the ingredients photo in this description listing is blurred out, leaving consumers unable to read the print...if it is in English, that is. My 5 pound dog seemed to enjoy them, however, I do not care to give my small pup rawhide, and would not have made this purchase had the ingredients stated this.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: great daily addition to your dog's dental health
customer_reviews.text: recommended by a friend years ago and once I started using them, even my Vet said they are a great addition. He'd thought she needed to be put under for her teeth to be cleaned (at age 5) and after 1 year of daily use (1 stick / day) she no longer needed that expensive procedure! HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AS1225

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I had bought these for years and my dog loved them. Then came the long period where they just weren't available. Finally they are now back on the market -- so I bought six bags. My dog won't touch them! He gets so excited because he remembers them from before, but when I give him one he carries it around for a few minutes then drops it on the floor. He used to just gobble them down. There is something seriously wrong with this product now. It is very suspicious that they were unavailable so long and now they are apparently not edible. I won't be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: DKF

customer_reviews.title: My picky eating dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. Not sure why the petite sizes are made with different ingredients than the larger sizes. This one isn’t raw hide like the larger sizes. One of my picky dogs likes the petite ones more than the medium ones. Wish these were sold bigger because my dogs should be eating the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: LW2

customer_reviews.title: Dogs wouldn't touch them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs normally love these chews. I bought the small size thinking that I'd be able to save some money, and also give them a smaller sized treat. However, as much as they love the medium and large sizes, none of my 4 would touch these. The composition of these is very different (even though it's not, they look grainy. . ) than the medium ones, and maybe that's the problem, but to consider these the same product, just different sizes is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: ald

customer_reviews.title: Yorkie loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Tried a couple enzymatic chews for 11 yo Yorkie dental issues. These are the only ones she will actually chew on and receive full effect.
customer_reviews.author: T. Valeri

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these. We use them as part of his tooth maintenance program. These together with Science Diet Oral Care food has resulted in no more teeth having to be pulled, which is a huge savings. Our dog is a 10 pounder. These smaller dogs always have teeth problem as the come to middle age.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Guy

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them and they seem to help the tartar problem
customer_reviews.text: After having gone through the expense and trauma of teeth-cleanings twice for my small dog, I make sure he gets one of these every day, along with brushing his teeth. He loves them, looks forward to having one daily and they seem to work, as the tartar is not building up as it had before.
customer_reviews.author: zoey

customer_reviews.title: Vet Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended these after we had to pay $850 for my Yorkie to get a couple rotten teeth extracted. We give her one a day and her bad breath is gone and her teeth have less plaque. Our vet said it’s the best dental stick on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Enzymatic dog chews for tarter build up.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this enzyme chew for my 2 year old maltipoo. I noticed there was a small buildup of light tarter near gums of canines. He gets one semi hard chew stick daily and seems to enjoy them. I have not detected any odor. I can see a lessening of build up as days go by. I am pleased with these and will rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Scofield

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Waited to late to return. My dog used to love these but this batch makes her vomit and she rejects most of it. Wish I could receive my money back as I have one whole unopened bag and almost 3/4 of a bag. Won’t buy this thru Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: mamamoumou

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my Vet
customer_reviews.text: This is used as my dogs "toothbrush". I just ask her if she wants to brush her teeth and she comes running. So far she has clean teeth and no bad breath. They strips are sized to weight of dog. She gets one a day. I didnt care for the package that came with different size pieces.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Keep your furbabies teeth clean
customer_reviews.text: I have picky old Pomeranians, they’re hard to please and they didn’t really want anything to do with these, other than carry it around .They have no order they’re well-made well packaged . I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Barb schank

customer_reviews.title: Threw Away - ZERO STARS
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our Yorkie and gave him one. Later he got sick but we did not contribute it to the treats. I put the package in the freezer since we had a few bags of treats open at the time. Recently we took them out and gave one to our Gino. About an hour later he threw up again. This was the second purchase of a similar product that made him sick. There is evidently something in this type of treat that he can't handle. Don't be surprised if your dog gets sick too.
customer_reviews.author: mleg

customer_reviews.title: Not petite and not edible according to my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 Chihuahuas so when this said petite I thought they would be small. They're about 5 or 6 inches long and1 inch wide. They resemble the chicken jerky that there's been some controversy over so that wasn't good in my estimation,. The biggest problem wasn't either of those issues but the fact that none of my dogs wanted anything to do with them. I have one dog that will eat absolutely anything and she took this when I gave it to her and then just dropped it and looked at me like "what, now you're trying to feed me cardboard?" Returned for a refund. Thankfullly Amazon's customer service is awesome as always.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: BOTH OF MY PETS LOVE THEM.
customer_reviews.text: I have two miniature Dachshunds. I recently had to have their teeth cleaned (An ongoing, very expensive, problem with this breed) My Vet suggested these Chews. BOTH OF MY PETS LOVE THEM..They look for more when they are done. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these chews.
customer_reviews.text: These look unappealing but my dog enthusiastically disagrees! He really likes them and they are good for his teeth. This size is perfect for a 13 pound dog. Though sometimes I break them into pieces and give them to him throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: alm1985

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product for Oral Health
customer_reviews.text: The breeder I got my cairn terrier puppy recommended these for teeth & gum health. I give her one every day - she LOVES it, and she has sparkly whites when she "smiles!" I also started using this on my brother's older dog (he's 5) - he loves them too, and I have seen improvement in the form of plaque removal/decline since I started giving them to him. Only caution/recommendation is that you are with the dog when you give one of these to him/her. The older dog "wolfs" it down, and some of the pieces that are created can be a little shard-looking. Just nervous from a choking perspective; something for dog owners to consider.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Best Dental Treats Ever!
customer_reviews.text: The trick to using these treats is to give them no more than one every other day depending on the size of your dog. A dog over 30 pounds could tolerate 1 every day. These treats have been instrumental in passing my dog's dental check ups every six months. They are great for tarter build up.
customer_reviews.author: Bookin2life

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Chew, Does As Advertised, Dog Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: Our 24lb miniature American Eskimo mix loves these chew toys! They are of excellent quality, do as advertised (her teeth are seriously pearly white and her breath never stinks), and are affordable. The petite is a perfect size for her and she knows to take them to the side rug to enjoy/chew. Like any other chew though, we only provide it to her with supervision. Most importantly, they do not upset her tummy and her poops come out just fine. Most other chews cause diarrhea, but not these. Also, numerous vets have advised against the "green" chews, so these are perfect in lieu of those and bones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: She seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: I just gave my dog her first chew. At first, she hid it but after I split it in two, she realized she should eat it. I think she enjoyed it and hope it helps her teeth. Does not have a strong smell (thankfully).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great when broken into pieces for a small dog with a very small mouth!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my little dog. They have to be broken into pieces so she can chew them. And these are bendable enough to break. The pieces are small and not jagged. We play fetch inside with them. Many people think they are too flimsy or not enough to benefit the dog. And they are right, if you have a bigger dog etc. These are perfect for a small, dog with a small size mouth . And I’m reviewing the snallest size. For my dog, they have to be broken. There’s no way my 6 pound Maltese could manipulate the stick otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have a small Havanese dog who is a cute, spoiled, and picky eater. I have attempted many different ways to get her teeth cleaned including enzymatic tooth paste and other brands of dental chews which none have succeeded as she refused them all. The C.E.T. Enzymatic Oral Hygiene Chews worked wonder as she is eating all of it by mixing this with her other meals ingredients. In a couple of weeks, I noticed that her bad breath is completely gone. I am glad that this product works for her as I have been worrying about her existing gum problems which could lead to lost teeth in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: great if you want to kill your dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought several orders is this junk because I wanted to make sure it wasn't a fluke or a bad batch. These things are so dry and hard they're like shards of glass when your dog chews them. I gave my Pomeranian a small piece and he coughed for days after! I know he had splinters of this garbage stuck in his throat. It should be taken off the market!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H

customer_reviews.title: They really work for stinky breath
customer_reviews.text: After seeking the advice of our veterinarian I was informed that the enzyme in these dog treats are the next best thing to physically brushing my dog's teeth. My six pound Chihuahua bites like a rottweiler and has breath like a dead rhinoceros. These traits have helped immensely with his breath I can finally stand to be in the same room with him. I also gave them to our larger breed dog who is 40 pounds and she enjoyed them so much that she tries to steal them off of the counter. These treats have allowed me to enjoy being around my dog again thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: My Cairn Terrier loves these! Actually, he only likes the small size. I bought him the medium size once and he wouldn't even bite them once. The "petite" size though, he excitedly runs away with and eats right away. These are AMAZING for cleaning his teeth. I noticed some build up some time after he got his adult teeth, gave him these, and it's GONE. I instructed my family back home to give them to our older family dog too. I wish I had known about them sooner, it would have saved us a fortune in cleaning fees for our 13 year old Cairn Terrier (you know how much that anesthesia, plus EKG for older dogs, costs!).
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Very upsetting to my dog's stomach.
customer_reviews.text: No stars for these things. My daughter's vet recommended them so I got a bag for my dog. He started waking up between 3 and 5 AM every day or so with upset stomach and would pace for hours, eat grass, and refuse food. This would go on until early afternoon. I didn't connect it with the chews, but took him to the vet where he did extensive blood work and physical exam with no bad results. When I got home I started thinking about what was different and thought of the chews. As soon as I took him off them, he was fine. No more problems. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JI

customer_reviews.title: I don't know whats going on I ordered this like 6 months ago for my boy and he really ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know whats going on I ordered this like 6 months ago for my boy and he really loved them but this time he's not eating them he just digs them in places. I haven't noticed a change in looks or smells or anything. Maybe he's just not crazy about them anymore because he's been without them for about 2 months. When he was chewing them it did freshen his breath. I still brush his teeth though. Some days when I'm lazy I just tossed him one of these but now he's not eating them so I'm forced to brush his teeth .
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them!
customer_reviews.text: The lure of the dental chew, wow, my cavachon loves it. She always want to come with me when I am leaving the house, which sometimes is just not possible. The easiest way to let her temporarily forget about me, is to give her this dental chew, I guess whatever the attraction I imagine myself to have, it really can’t compete with this piece of stick! The only downsize is she can finish it in no time, so I also get the kind for large dogs. Of course her breath is beautifully sweet.
customer_reviews.author: meh

customer_reviews.title: Senior loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that would satisfy my 17 yr. old terrier mix. He used to love chews, but now he’s getting older and loosing a few teeth, he can longer manage rawhides or Kongs the way he used to. I also wanted to give him something besides the ever present Greenie. These do the trick. They’re just the right size and consistency I’ve been looking for. Nothing too hard or soft for him to chew on. Price – much better on Amazon that the Vet’s office.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs enjoy these chews and they really seem to help to keep their teeth clean. I do brush their teeth, but it's not easy for me to do a really thorough job, so I give them these chews to increase the efficacy of their oral hygiene routine. . I buy these chews, three packages at a time, because they're effective and my two dogs absolutely love the product. It's unfortunate, but the price here has gone crazy. I'm a Prime member so I really hate to pay shipping. However, even with paying shipping, the end cost is much less elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LilyBell2

customer_reviews.title: Product is (usually) great. (This time there was an issue)
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. My 37-pound dog adores it and the results are clear: the vet was amazed at how clean and healthy our dog's teeth were at the last annual visit. (And when we rescued this puppy he refused to chew hard stuff or being tooth-brushed.) However, this time we bought the product from a seller that sent us a rancid package. The sticks sink. We cannot find the expiration date anywhere so it's hard to file an online complaint... plus we got this at a terribly busy time of the year and there was just no time to waste on returning them... (we should have!) So, in sum: WONDERFUL PRODUCT, but awful experience with the vendor (Virbac?)
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: My girls love this treat- I break them in half- easy to break- and they devour them s a treat and at bedtime. They look forward to them as soon as they hear me open the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: but they don't love them. I haven't really seen them make a ...
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs eat these, but they don't love them. I haven't really seen them make a difference yet but I'm continuing the use because my dachshunds have bad teeth, and I think they're a solid preventative measure. They're getting dentals soon so we'll continue to use these as a part of our treat routine. Plus, you can't beat the add-on price, when you're purchasing other items from Amazon anyway.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These clean your dogs teeth wonderfully..
customer_reviews.text: These clean your dogs teeth wonderfully...if you can get them to take one...so far only one of my three Chihuahuas will . im thinking they must be too bland ok im adding this to my review....Do Not buy these if your dog ison a grain free diet..My dog suffered from my stupidity and now im stuck with them...its a shame since he loved them
customer_reviews.author: 3 Chihuahuas :)

customer_reviews.title: Our dog would NOT touch these!
customer_reviews.text: These are flat rawhide chews, which I thought would allow our small dog an easily manageable size treat. The dog had ZERO interest them. I even tried breaking the first (and last) one into smaller pieces and making a game to increase interest. These might have well been spinach to a child! None of these replace brushing your dog's teeth but was looking for something with the least amount of "junk-food" in a treat. Finally gave up - the dog would NOT touch them and sat by the cookie jar, instead. I wouldn't recommend these to anyone who's dog has tried more flavorful chew treats....they DO know the difference!
customer_reviews.author: lioness_403

customer_reviews.title: Terrific! My dog is about 11 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! My dog is about 11 lbs. and the vet recommended these since he is so small. I give him 1/2 at a time and he enjoys them very much. Since they are minced before shaping, there is much less chance of chocking him. I still observe him as he chews them, but I think That is recommended with any type chew. His teeth were in better shape this vet check up than usual and I relate that to these chews. Small dogs naturally have more tarter than larger dogs, so I think these will help to maintain his teeth between cleanings.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Dental Chews
customer_reviews.text: We have small dogs with dental issues. After second cleaning, vet recommended trying these chews. Results amazing! Reduced existing tartar. Clean teeth for 2 years now. A little pricey, but you avoid vet cost and risk of sedating pet. Sometimes the chews are too hard for our chihuahuas, so I place in a wet paper towel and microwave for 20 seconds. Let cool and they are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fights bad breath in dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these several times for my mini-dachsund who would otherwise have breath that would make a strong person faint. He looks forward to these as a bedtime treat, and I look forward to them as his breath now smells better than my husband's. In the past, I've had Oscar's teeth cleaned yearly, but he still would have stinky breath. As he's gotten older (12 years old now), the anesthesia has been hard for him, and I think I am going to rely completely on these for keeping his teeth clean and breath fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product made my dog SICK!!! I hadn't changed anything in her diet other than introducing these treats to her. She only had one and the same night she started to throw up. The following day she had stools BLOODY stools, and loss of appetite. The little she would drink and eat she couldn't keep down because she would VOMIT. This lasted for about 3-4 days. I tossed the entire package in the trash right after because that's EXACTLY WHAT THESE TREATS ARE---GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: thinks these are the best thing. He prefers them to all other treats
customer_reviews.text: Our dog, Sebastian, thinks these are the best thing. He prefers them to all other treats. He doesn't know they are for oral hygiene. :-) However, there are virtually never the advertised number of chew sticks in a bag. There are never more. The vast majority of bags have fewer. This unacceptable. The bags might have the advertised weight. However, who gives their dog(s) chew sticks by weight? We give our dog, Sebastian, 3 chew sticks a day. That's why it's obvious to us that the claim of 30 sticks is false. Virbac needs to address this issue. Otherwise we'll look for suitable substitute.
customer_reviews.author: D. Feltus

customer_reviews.title: saved my tiny chi a vet visit
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance buying this. I dont give my dogs rawhide as they can choke on them. But my poor Chihuahua had a black tooth in the back and the product reviews were so good I thought it was worth trying. WOW! After about two weeks (1/2one in the am and 1/2 at night) my three pound baby's teeth are sparkling white. Yes even the tooth that was black is white. (Oh and it doesnt make her chooke as it is tiny pieces pressed together.) Thankfully it wasnt a cavity. I am so happy it saved me a vet visit and saved her from being put under. This product is nothing short of a miracle!
customer_reviews.author: 4fun

customer_reviews.title: They do  work
customer_reviews.text: This product did make a huge difference in my dog’s breath and plaque. However, my dog refused to eat a second chew or any subsequent offerings. She just doesn’t care for the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Dana in Franklin

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves em!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these!!! I also use the CET toothpaste, which my dog loves as well. He gets excited everytime I brush my teeth, because he thinks he's getting his brushed!! These combined with the toothpaste helps freshen his breath and he is always complimented on how white his teeth are. Win win! Additionally, they snap easily so you can stretch a package by breaking them up. I have a small dog who doesn't need to est a whole one everytime (I'm sure he would disagree!).
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves them and at 8 years, her teeth are beautiful and healthy. This is the only chewy product that she does not get sick with. Make sure your dog has water after eating. Coco is always thirsty afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Jerri Anne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great chews
customer_reviews.text: These are better priced here than from the vet, and my small dog loves them. Never chokes on the end pieces and keeps her occupied for a while chewing them.
customer_reviews.author: JandE

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the great reviews and my dogs have bad teeth. I wasted my money. They smell and taste (yes, I did a small taste!) of baking soda. My dogs were smarter than me and wouldn’t even taste them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily dental care
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for over a year now based on a recommendation. When my dog goes in for his yearly checkup, the vet always reports my dog's teeth show little plague and gums look healthy.
customer_reviews.author: CLT

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for Small Senior Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes after these pretty regularly. I feel as though this is a healthy choice as a treat as well as helping with his dental hygiene. This is a good size for a senior 15-lb poodle that has already lost a few teeth.
customer_reviews.author: WIN95GAL

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have five micro dachshunds. They are prone to bad breath and teeth. They don’t do much for the breath. But lord do they help get that plaque off! All of my dogs love them. We went through one small bag and already they were working so maybe 3-4 treats per pup. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Dog's Vet says they are the best way too go
customer_reviews.text: I bought them as my vet likes the Virbac C.E.T. products and I would like to keep my dogs teeth clean and healthy instead of paying $200-$300 every 6-9 mos to get her teeth professionally cleaned under anesthesia. The anesthesia scares me but boy do her teeth look great afterwards. Dogs lose teeth do to bad dental care and I take care of all my dogs health issues and she has been healthy as can be ever since I got her. She eats the best food, has her fur brushed with a furminator and has her teeth brushed and her nails dremeled smooth. She is very healthy but she is my buddy and deserves the best
customer_reviews.author: jimmymac

customer_reviews.title: Composite not solid; dog loves but eats, not chews them
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize these were composite -- the larger size I had last time were solid pieces of rawhide; he eats these way faster which I dont think does the teeth/mouth as much good as chewing on the solid ones did (I give one at bedtime so that the enzymes are the last thing into his mouth for the day.) He still loves them, though. Next time I'll get the bigger ones and cut them in two with tin snips. The point is not to just eat the stuff, it's to chew it well. Which they made strips this size in solid pieces, that would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Really helps keep her teeth clean & she loves them.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these as a real for my little dog for about 5 years & she doesn’t need her teeth cleaned per my vet again this year. She loves them & I can get miles of use by breaking the chews int 3 smaller pieces. My dog loves them & so do I!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bauer

customer_reviews.title: I like them more than my dogs do!
customer_reviews.text: Not that I have tried to chew on them, but I like the size and idea of these treats. Cleaner teeth would be wonderful. I have 2 small dogs - 5 and 7 pounds and they are very picky. They are mostly meat eaters. These are made in Mexico, and state that they are recommended by veterinarians. Their product analysis says 75% crude protein, 1% crude fat, 8% crude fiber, 14% moisture and 27 calories. The number one ingredient is beef hide. Sounded close enough to meat for me - but not for my dogs. I am not giving up on this bag of chews, because I am hoping that my dogs will eventually take to them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like it
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs and only 2 of them seem to like these. I don’t know if it’s actually taking the tartar off their teeth yet, I will have to keep an eye.
customer_reviews.author: Kung Fu Sparky

customer_reviews.title: which up until recently was sweet smelling, was beginning to smell quite sour
customer_reviews.text: My shih tzu just turned 3 and hates to have his teeth brushed! I've recently notice that his breath, which up until recently was sweet smelling, was beginning to smell quite sour. So, when I read about these, I decided to give them a try. Within 2-3 days I noticed his halitosis was gone! In additon, he loves them! The reason for 4 instead of 5 stars? The price and he finishes one in a minute or 2 (I was hoping they would replace his regular rawhide bones which last all day). I probably will repurchase though, esp if the Vet feel they've helped.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria P

customer_reviews.title: Great treats for my baby’s Teeth!
customer_reviews.text: Great treats and good for my baby’s teeth to help prevent tartar buildup. Cheaper than other sites and received them the same day I ordered. What fantastic service and quality!
customer_reviews.author: M J Morris

customer_reviews.title: Rocky & Rosie's Favorite Treat
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended these treats to help keep my dog's teeth clean and they really do the job. The dogs love them. They get so excited when Daddy gets the bag out. I would recommend them to anyone who is concerned with their dog's dental health. There are many sizes to choose from. My dogs are small, sometimes we break them in half.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a treat but didn't get rid of my husky's bad breat
customer_reviews.text: my Siberian husky loved these but I bought hoping these would help with her bad breath...nope...these were specifically recommended by the vet but overall she loved as a treat
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: Improves Doggy Breath, Won't Break the Bank
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a fan and, really, what more can you ask for out of a dog treat? They seem to help her breath be slightly less bad at first, but the effects lessen as we near the end of the bag, so I tend to switch these out with other healthy, teeth cleansing snacks. It's a routine that works for us and Abby (my pup) is always excited to see me pick up the bag. It's gotten to the point where she thinks there's something for her in every order from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Megan P.

customer_reviews.title: Old yorkie teeth approved
customer_reviews.text: I hope this helps someone- I have an old Yorkie who has genetic teeth issues. Admittedly we don’t brush his teeth like should. His breath was so bad i could smell him across the room- these basically solved that and he loves them. They also aren’t too hard to chew for the old dude
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: Good to help remove food stain from dog teeth
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product for dog teeth. My dog's teeth have greatly improved since we began giving him these sticks. They are white and less stained.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them but took a long time to arrive
customer_reviews.text: We've been giving these to our dogs after their dinner every night and it does seem to help keep their teeth clean. They love them and wait for them after dinner. My only complaint is that this last time we ordered them they have taken a really long time to arrive. I hope this is not a trend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pecunia

customer_reviews.title: Our vet recommended these to keep their teeth clean
customer_reviews.text: We have two smaller dogs, one pure bred Toy fox terrier, and a mixed weinie/terrier/chihuahua. Our vet recommended these to keep their teeth clean. The toy fox terrier (Penny), has had her teeth cleaned a few times, but these are keeping her teeth clean so she wont have to have them surgically cleaned.She is almost 11 years old. They both love these, and we love that this is helping to keep their teeth clean.
customer_reviews.author: gatorriffstudios

customer_reviews.title: My dogs would not eat these treats
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for my little dogs because I was looking for a more effective dental treat to compliment their daily brushing. This has enzymes just like their dog toothpaste, so I figured it would help their teeth more than the other dental treat we had been using. Unfortunately, we didn't get to see how well (or not well) this works, because neither of my dogs would eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.KMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them.  Non-Choking treat.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love them and they come apart so they don’t choke one of my dogs, like the rawhide chews do. I don’t know if the really do anything for oral hygiene. Really brushing your dog’s teeth is better, but this is much faster and easier
customer_reviews.author: ellen sf

customer_reviews.title: Happy for baby
customer_reviews.text: My fur baby looks forward to these every morning. To me it smells like cardboard but she loves it and it helps keeps her teeth fresh and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda M

product_meta.title: Virbac Enzymatic Dog Chews
product_meta.description: Size:Petite/Small| Color:NaturalC.E.T. Enzymatic Oral Hygiene Chews for Dogs feature an exclusive Dual Enzyme System, plus an abrasive texture. Working with the dog's chewing action, C.E.T. Enzymatic Oral Hygiene Chews reduce plaque and tartar helping keep teeth clean and breath fresh, even on days when brushing isn’t possible. Available in Petite, Medium, Large and Extra Large sizes.
feature_bullets: 1 SMALL ENZYMATIC CHEWS BAG: Made for dogs under 11 lbs; Package contains approximately 30 chews per bag; Chew size and thickness may vary in package

DAILY DENTAL CARE: Features an exclusive Dual Enzyme System and abrasive texture to help reduce plaque and tartar through dog’s chewing action; To maximize effectiveness, give your dog at least 1 chew daily
HIGHLY PALATABLE: The chews are poultry flavored providing a taste dogs love, Made using select beef hide
VET RECOMMENDED: The C. E. T. product line is the #1 Recommended dental brand by Veterinary professionals

CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Virbac is committed to providing great customer satisfaction; For questions or concerns about the product you may reach out directly to the Virbac Support Team (contact info provided on each bag)
TRANSITIONING TO THE SIZE "NEW EXTRA SMALL" item is discontinued from manufacturer
